comments:
Take a file, any file...

Open it within a configuration where Folding is turned on for Inner types and 
Imports (haven't tried other variations)

Do ctrl+shift+f - format the code
Then do ctrl+z  - undo

The file gets corrupted in horrible ways and pops up (sometimes) one of two 
different error message boxes. By corrupted, I mean lines deleted, or split 
apart - all sorts of stuff. Tends to vary between files, but is consistent 
within the same file (ie repeat the operation and you get the same effect)

The editor often then becomes unresponsive and fails to repaint

This is major because it means you have to discard the editor - which may end 
up to having to lose code changes...

Apologies, I meant to state that: It is in M9 - with no third-party plugins

In the .log file, I have the two exceptions below. These are repeated many 
times in the .log - which would probably equate to the amount of times I tried 
this to see if I could reproduce it...
